programme.title: Secret Wars Uncovered S1 - "Coups Detat"
programme.desc: An uncompromising show of power, the military coup is an age-old method to violently and often secretly topple governments and take control by force. This episode goes behind the scenes of some of the greatest coups in recent history.

programme.title: Angry Planet S3 - "Arctic Winter"
programme.desc: George links up with two experienced polar adventurers in the frigid Canadian arctic in the depths of winter. First uses skis to cross the fractured sea ice of Frobisher Bay, then dog teams to head north through the spectacular Auyuittuq Mountains.

programme.title: Angry Planet S3 - "Polynesian Volcanoes"
programme.desc: Filming the volcanoes, mudpools and geysers in the geothermic wonderland of New Zealand’s north island, we learn that a new island is being created by an undersea volcano 1000 miles north in Tonga

programme.title: Angry Planet S1 - "Tornados"
programme.desc: George tracks a building storm that threatens that tough mid-western city, chases a hail storm, fights to get in the middle of a vicious dust-devil and the funky roadside Americana of the American Midwest

programme.title: Angry Planet S1 - "Desert Monsoon"
programme.desc: Host/adventurer George Kourounis ups the danger factor by traveling with wild atheist shock-jock R.J. Evans to track massive lightning storms which can produce bolts of up to one hundred million volts.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S1 - "Future of Crime Fighting"
programme.desc: Host Joe Penna talks to designers who’ve created a robotic security guard.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S1 - "The Future of Medicine"
programme.desc: Host Joe Penna examines electronic skin that keeps tabs of your vital functions and warns of trouble.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S1 - "The Future of Wearable Tech"
programme.desc: Join host Joe Penna as meets a colorblind man who, thanks to a revolutionary piece of technology, has become a well-known visual artist who ‘hears’ colors.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S1 - "Future Living Spaces"
programme.desc: Host Joe Penna goes on a voyage of discovery that takes him to underwater homes, and even homes built in tiny parking spots.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "Future Directions"
programme.desc: This episode looks at the development of new human-rated spacecraft, reusable boosters, laser communications, the Ion Drive and new techniques to refuel satellites in space.

programme.title: Women Make Science S1 - "RoboGal (AKA Queen of Robots)"
programme.desc: One of the world’s leading tech developers is creating a new generation of robots designed to help people with everyday tasks.

programme.title: Speed S1 - "Across Continents"
programme.desc: Never in the history of humanity have so many of us been mobile. New innovations propel us into the world of self-driving cars and high-speed trains.

programme.title: Speed S1 - "Into the Skies"
programme.desc: Growth in air transportation is set to soar, carrying over 10 billion passengers every year by 2050. To cope requires us to radically rethink aircraft design. Join us as we look into the world's most innovative research and development labs.

programme.title: Speed S1 - "Into Space"
programme.desc: The most innovative area of human motion lies not on Earth, but with the exploration of space. Meet the private space entrepreneurs jostling to offer the tantalizing prospect of cheap, frequent travel beyond the atmosphere into Earth orbit.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S2 - "Ancient Waterways"
programme.desc: The ancient ancestors realized that building structures and machines to harness water to provide transport, power, drainage and irrigation was vital to the success of their civilizations.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S2 - "Building Bridges"
programme.desc: Our ancient ancestors had to come up with ingenious solutions and structures to travel freely - over the hills, valleys and rivers of our world.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S2 - "Mojave air and Space Port"
programme.desc: Join Emily Calandrelli as she explores Mojave Air and Space Port and the technologies of tomorrow that will lead the way in space exploration.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S2 - "Aliens"
programme.desc: Join Host Emily Calandrelli as she explores the latest in science’s search for life outside of planet Earth.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "Citizen Science"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli discovers various ways the public is helping scientists explore outer space; from sending bacteria samples to the International Space Station to tweeting observations about the Northern Lights.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "Surviving Space"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli visits NASA’s Swamp Works, which tests space suits and machines for Mars-like conditions.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S1 - "Time"
programme.desc: Jack meets a woman who has lost all sense of time and reveals how time can be elastic.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S1 - "The Senses"
programme.desc: Jack meets people with synaesthesia and experiences multisensory gastronomy.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S1 - "Pain & Fear"
programme.desc: Wim Hof teaches Jack how to control his pain and plunge into the ice cold sea.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S1 - "Creativity"
programme.desc: Jack meets a man with Sudden Artistic Output syndrome and unleashes his creativity.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "The Science Of The Senses"
programme.desc: A look into the mechanics of taste and smell with an exploration of the global flavor industry and the science of creating new flavors and smells.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "Curing Cancer"
programme.desc: An innovative gene therapy has produced a significant breakthrough that could lead to a cure for cancer.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "The Longevity Gene"
programme.desc: Studying the genes and lifestyles of centenarians. The results may offer answers to living longer and fighting diseases.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "The Science Of Water Sustainability"
programme.desc: Looking at solutions for water scarcity from fog catching nets to water efficient washing machines.

programme.title: The Demolition Man S1 - "Liverpool"
programme.desc: The sheer size of these buildings automatically makes this a very difficult job but these towers are also surrounded by hundreds of homes.

programme.title: The Demolition Man S1 - "Newcastle"
programme.desc: Taking down eight giant towers will take expert precision, planning & explosives. It’s imperative none of them fall in the wrong direction or fire any debris.

programme.title: The Demolition Man S1 - "City of London"
programme.desc: An asbestos ridden 1960s building in the crowded City of London is to be demolished to make way for a new hotel.

programme.title: The Demolition Man S1 - "The Best of Part 2"
programme.desc: Brendan Moar looks back at the most interesting and dramatic moments that he’s encountered as The Demolition Man.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S2 - "Ex-Men The Origins of Terry"
programme.desc: Terry and Larry test a famous scene from X-men. They are attempting to see if you can split a bullet with a Katana sword

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S2 - "Pay Terry Back"
programme.desc: Terry and Larry test 2 scenes from Mel Gibson’s film Payback. Mel's character is in the back of a taxi when 4 bad guys pull up next to him in an SUV, they open fire and Mel uses a bad guy in the cab as a shield.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S2 - "Paint Your Red River Stagecoach at High Noon"
programme.sub-title: Paint Your Red River Stagecoach at High Noon
programme.desc: Terry and Larry will test different famous shots from westerns. Can you shoot a cowboy hat off the bad guy? Will a shotgun blast really throw you back through a window? Can a single shot from a colt revolver break shackles?

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S2 - "Terry's Underworld"
programme.desc: Terry and Larry are going to test a famous scene from Underworld with Kate Beckensale. Terry will attempt to shoot a circle around himself in the floor and fall through to save himself from the pack of werewolves.

programme.title: Wonder S1 - "Phantoms"
programme.desc: What is the Body Transfer Illusion or the Moon Illusion? We also explain how the Autokinetic Effect and the Stereoscopy work!

programme.title: Wonder S1 - "Art of illusion"
programme.desc: How are Rainbows formed? What does it mean to see a Mirage? And when we see a spinning dancer why one can either perceive as spinning clockwise or counter clockwise?
